description: A suspected Romano-British temple located besides Badbury Rings. Dating is suggested by coin evidence found in the temple.
bibliography: “Earthworks of Romano-British Temple SW of Badbury Rings, Kingston Lacy Estate,” n.d. https://heritagerecords.nationaltrust.org.uk/HBSMR/MonRecord.aspx?uid=MNA138090.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Badbury Romano-Celtic Temple (Dorset).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
———. “Evaluation Excavation, Badbury Romano-Celtic Temple: Interim Report.” Poceedings of the Dorset Natural History and Archaeological Society 122 (2000).
“The Romano-Celtic Temple at Badbury Rings, Dorset,” Proceedings of the Dorset Natural History and Archaeological Society, 135 (2014): 242–71.
